David's tsuba of the maple tree with leaves shows greater 
sophistication i=
n detail than the original deer/maple tsuba being 
discussed. The branches =
really give a wood feeling with a minimum of 
carved accents. The original =
tsuba I believe is a simple 
representation of a still/quiet moment, unmovi=
ng, of deer in a 
glade. A brief instant of peace/harmony. Quite opposed to=
, as in a 
discussion I have had recently, where certain sukashi motif depi=
ct 
motion. The stiffness that some observe is, I think, this frozen 
table=
au and intentional. John
